summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a voluntary interview with Lieutenant M, a Federal Bureau of Prisons Activities Lieutenant at MCC New York, regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The interview was conducted on July 12, 2021, and the memorandum includes a list of attached documents related to prison operations and counts on August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on August 10, 2019; the subject of the OIG death investigation.

persons.name: Lieutenant M
persons.role: Activities Lieutenant, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: BOP staff member interviewed by OIG agents regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death; was the Activities Lieutenant at MCC New York on August 9, 2019.

connections.description: Lieutenant M was the Activities Lieutenant at the MCC New York facility where Jeffrey Epstein was housed prior to his death.

events.title: OIG Interview of Lieutenant M
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview of BOP Lieutenant M regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Lieutenant M's Shift Before Epstein's Death
events.description: Lieutenant M served as Activities Lieutenant at MCC New York on the day before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an interview with BOP Lieutenant M on July 12, 2021, as part of its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Lieutenant M was the Activities Lieutenant at MCC New York on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell.
The memorandum references numerous attached documents including MCC New York daily assignment rosters, count documentation, round check sheets, and logs from August 9-10, 2019.
The document states the interview was recorded and transcribed, and the recording was saved separately due to its large file size.
